page.title: 18RIVER AVON, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: The brook in Great Somerford that joins the river Avon used to flood into the fields around it.It is now dredged every twenty years to stop this happening.It was last done about two years ago.When it was last dredged a lot of plants started to grow on the opposite bank.The seeds that were under stones were disturbed and this caused the seeds to float to the bank and settle.In winter the river used to flood and make a stream between Great Somerford and Little Somerford so that people going from one village to the other had to wade or row across.The Somerfords got their names from the ford in summer.The main field by the brook is now used for corn instead of grazing so along the bank weeds grow and are no longer eaten by cattle.
